dependencies.description:
The apptools project includes a set of packages that Enthought has found
useful in creating a number of applications. They implement
functionality that is commonly needed by many applications.
dependencies.name: py-apptools

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: Observable typed attributes for Python classes.
dependencies.name: py-traits

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: Mayavi: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python.
dependent_to.name: py-mayavi

description:
Envisage is a Python-based framework for building extensible
applications, that is, applications whose functionality can be extended
by adding "plug-ins". Envisage provides a standard mechanism for
features to be added to an application, whether by the original
developer or by someone else. In fact, when you build an application
using Envisage, the entire application consists primarily of plug-ins.
In this respect, it is similar to the Eclipse and Netbeans frameworks
for Java applications.
name: py-envisage

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
